titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Alice Lear Autograph Album 1884-1894
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Teresa Hamann

publicationstmt.publisher: Maureen and Mike Mansfield Library, The University of Montana-Missoula

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Teresa Hamann 2011

repository.corpname: University of Montana, Mansfield Library, Archives and Special Collections

did.abstract: The Alice Lear Autograph Album includes often poetic good wishes from her family and friends in Missouri and Montana, 1889-1894. It also includes a single letter, 1884.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Alice Jane Myers was born in Scotland County, Missouri, on 6 September 1860. She married William D. Lear in Millport, Missouri on 11 February 1879. She was the mother of four children, a son and her only daughter dying in childhood. According to the 1900 US Census, Alice Lear and her husband were living in Corvallis, Montana, with their two children, James and Paul. She died in Corvallis in March of 1936.

scopecontent.p: The Alice Lear autograph album includes often poetic good wishes from her family and friends in Missouri and Montana, 1889-1894. The family includes her father, mother, sister, in-laws, and niece. The towns listed as the writer's locations include Greensburg and Baring, Missouri, as well as Deer Lodge and Corvallis, Montana. It also includes a single letter addressed to "Dear Children" and signed "your Father," 1884.

accessrestrict.p: Researchers must use collection in accordance with the policies of Archives and Special Collections, the Maureen and Mike Mansfield Library, and The University of Montana-Missoula.

userestrict.p: Researchers are responsible for using in accordance with 17 U.S.C. and any other applicable statutes. Copyright not transferred to the University of Montana
